notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.

taskDescription: By knowing the natural abundances of minor isotopes, it’s possible to calculate the relative heights of M+ and M + 1 peaks. If 13C has a natural abundance of 1.10%, what are the relative heights of the M+ and M + 1 peaks in the mass spectrum of benzene, C6H6?
